content:
I hope this is an OK place to ask this. On github.com/backdrop-ops, once the port in a "Port request" or "Port in progress" issue has happened, how does one get the label changed to "Port complete"? It doesn't seem like the issue poster has the ability to change the label. I'm thinking specifically of this https://github.com/backdrop-ops/contrib/issues/434 and some others.

Backdrop Ops
Operations for Backdrop CMS. Backdrop Ops has 24 repositories available. Follow their code on GitHub.
Port request for SpamSpan Filter 路 Issue #434 路 backdrop-ops/contrib
Name of the module, theme, or layout SpamSpan Filter Link to the drupal.org module, theme, or layout https://www.drupal.org/project/spamspan
Yes, the Github permissions are a bit impractical for backdrop-ops. Asking either here in chat or in the issue should ping one of the people with permission to change the label.
I can close it as well, if it is done.
@bugfolder, the person who opened the issue was not you, which is why you cannot make the changes. Did djzwerg say that they could not update the issue? I'm not seeing that anywhere.

Hi @oadaeh (Jason Flatt) , I didn't query djzwerg about that, but there's other issues that I created and have been unable to change the label to "Port complete" even though I'm the creator of the issue. If you or other admins could make that change for these issues, I'd appreciate it.
https://github.com/backdrop-ops/contrib/issues/440
https://github.com/backdrop-ops/contrib/issues/437
https://github.com/backdrop-ops/contrib/issues/439
https://github.com/backdrop-ops/contrib/issues/441
https://github.com/backdrop-ops/contrib/issues/428
https://github.com/backdrop-ops/contrib/issues/442
@indigoxela , if I "ping" in the issue, what should I do differently to flag it to the attention of those with Label-Changing Powers?
I updated the labels for those issues.
@bugfolder pinging people here in this chat helps as well.

there's other issues that I created and have been unable to change the label to "Port complete" even though I'm the creator of the issue

Yep, also happened to me. That's why I think that the perms on backdrop-ops are impractical.

if I "ping" in the issue, what should I do differently to flag it to the attention of those with Label-Changing Powers?

@bugfolder very likely you get attention if you mention one of the people (@username) with "label-powers" ... if you know who has. :wink:

Maybe one of the Zulip admins (@StPaulTim, @klonos, ???) could create a user group for the people who have that capability, then one could @ the group without having to know who exactly needs to be pinged, and all the right people would get notified automatically. https://zulip.com/help/user-groups

User groups (Zulip Help Center)
User groups allow you to mention multiple users at once. When you mention a user group, everyone in the group is notified as if they were individually mentioned. | Note that user groups are not the same as group private messages. If you're trying to send a group of people a message, you'll want to either create a stream, or send a group private message. | Organization administrators can modify any user group. Members can modify any user group they are a part of. Guests cannot modify user groups. | We're here to help! Email us at support@zulip.com with questions, feedback, or feature requests.
